fields.name: Botox Anti-Wrinkle Injection
fields.description: Anti-wrinkle injections are referred to as Botox, short for Botulinum toxin. This is a naturally occurring protein that causes the muscles of the face to relax, consequently smoothing out wrinkles. Ageing takes its toll on our faces, skin and confidence. Wrinkles are a sign of ageing that we don’t have to live with thanks to safe and pain-free. Not only are anti-wrinkle injection safe and pain-free but results far exceed anti-wrinkle creams and therefore are more cost-effective. The treatment takes just a few minutes, saving time compared to applying anti-wrinkle creams twice a day.

fields.name: Lip Fillers
fields.description: Lip augmentation is an aesthetic procedure designed to give you fuller, plumper lips. It’s a treatment that’s proving to be as appealing to millennial’s as well as to more mature audience, catering to both women and men.

fields.name: Vampire Facial
fields.description: Vampire facials, a trendy skin care treatment that involves drawing blood from a client's body, placing it in a centrifuge, then reapplying it to the face, supposedly to promote cell renewal.

fields.name: PRP Injection
fields.description: Platelet-rich plasma (PRP) therapy uses injections of a concentration of a patient's own platelets to accelerate the healing of injured tendons, ligaments, muscles and joints. In this way, PRP injections use each individual patient's own healing system to improve musculoskeletal problems.

fields.name: Dermal Filler
fields.description: Dermal fillers are gel-like substances that are injected beneath the skin to restore lost volume, smooth lines and soften creases, or enhance facial contours.

fields.name: Non-Surgical Rhinoplasty
fields.description: Non-surgical rhinoplasty, commonly known as a “non-surgical nose job” which can take up to 15 minutes, is a way to correct imperfections in the nose without having to undergo costly, invasive surgical procedures. Non-surgical rhinoplasty uses dermal fillers to reshape the nose, and can be used to treat a variety of concerns. Most commonly, patients will seek to use dermal fillers to even out bumps in the nose or rectify a hook-like appearance by injecting the tip with filler to provide lift. Dermal fillers are made from hyaluronic acid which is a natural substance produced by the body, so patients undergoing dermal filler treatment can be certain of their proven safety and efficacy in producing subtle and natural-looking results. When injected by Dr Benji Dhillon, dermal fillers correct bumps and asymmetries of the nose by delivering volume, lift, and hydration.

fields.name: Mesotherpy
fields.description: Mesotherapy is a non surgical skin rejuvenation treatment aimed at diminishing problem areas on the face and body. Mesotherapy treatment can be used for face, neck and under eye rejuvenation and also for common concerns such as hair thinning. Mesotherapy treatments involve injecting Hyaluronic Acid directly into the mesoderm (middle layer of the skin). This nourishes and rejuvenates the skin by promoting the production of collagen and elastin and stimulates your skin’s metabolism. Using Mesotherapy for over 10 years at our accredited award winning Laser and Skin Clinic our clients have described their skin as looking ‘plumper, hydrated, radiant, glowing and firmer’ after a course of mesotherapy injections.

fields.name: Chemical Peels
fields.description: A chemical peel is a skin-resurfacing procedure in which a chemical solution is applied to the skin to remove the top layers. The skin that grows back after a chemical peel is smoother and younger looking. Chemical peels are used to treat wrinkles, skin discoloration and scars typically on the face.

fields.name: Examination Xray
fields.description: Dental X-rays (radiographs) are images of your teeth that your dentist uses to evaluate your oral health. These X-rays are used with low levels of radiation to capture images of the interior of your teeth and gums. This can help your dentist to identify problems, like cavities, tooth decay, and impacted teeth.

fields.name: Dential Hygiene
fields.description: A dental hygiene helps to prevent dental decay by cleaning patients' teeth and providing them with education about how to care effectively for their teeth and gums and the effects of diet on oral health.

fields.name: Crowns & Bridges
fields.description: Bridges and crowns are fixed prosthetic devices that are cemented onto existing teeth or implants by a dentist or prosthodontist. Crowns are used most commonly to entirely cover or 'cap' a damaged tooth or cover an implant. Bridges are commonly used to cover a space if you're missing one or more teeth.

fields.name: Restorations
fields.description: Restorations are the various ways your dentist can replace or restore missing teeth or missing parts of the tooth structure. Examples include fillings, crowns, bridges, implants and dentures.

fields.name: New Arrivals
fields.description: Vampire facials, a trendy skin care treatment that involves drawing blood from a client's body, placing it in a centrifuge, then reapplying it to the face, supposedly to promote cell renewal.
